adjective.description: Denoting language, especially burlesque verse, containing words or inflections from one language introduced into the context of another.

noun.description: Macaronic verse, especially that which mixes the vernacular with Latin.

origin: Early 17th century (in the sense characteristic of a jumble or medley): from modern Latin macaronicus, from obsolete Italian macaronico, a humorous formation from macaroni (see macaroni).
